info.name: TMI (Threat Modeling Improved) API
info.description: A RESTful API for collaborative threat modeling with full X6 graph library compatibility. This API provides schemas that align with AntV X6 cell object models for seamless integration with modern diagramming libraries. Supports OAuth 2.0 authentication with client callback integration for seamless single-page application authentication flows.

request.description: Returns service, API, and operator information without authentication
Returns OpenID Connect provider configuration metadata as per RFC 8414
Returns OAuth 2.0 authorization server metadata as per RFC 8414
Returns the JSON Web Key Set (JWKS) for JWT signature verification

urlencoded.description: Optional hint about the type of token being introspected

request.description: Introspects a JWT token to determine its validity and metadata as per RFC 7662

urlencoded.description: Optional hint about the type of token being introspected
Optional hint about the type of token being introspected

request.description: Returns a list of configured OAuth providers available for authentication

query.description: OAuth provider identifier. Defaults to 'test' provider in non-production builds if not specified.
Client callback URL where TMI should redirect after successful OAuth completion with tokens as query parameters. If not provided, tokens are returned as JSON response.
CSRF protection state parameter. Recommended for security. Will be included in the callback response.

User identity hint for test OAuth provider. Allows specifying a desired user identity for testing and automation. Only supported by the test provider (ignored by production providers like Google, GitHub, etc.). Must be 3-20 characters, alphanumeric and hyphens only.
(Required) OAuth 2.0 scope parameter. For OpenID Connect, must include "openid". Supports "profile" and "email" scopes. Other scopes are silently ignored. Space-separated values.

request.description: Redirects user to OAuth provider's authorization page. Supports client callback URL for seamless client integration. Generates state parameter for CSRF protection.

response.name: Redirect to OAuth provider authorization page

query.description: OAuth provider identifier. Defaults to 'test' provider in non-production builds if not specified.
Client callback URL where TMI should redirect after successful OAuth completion with tokens as query parameters. If not provided, tokens are returned as JSON response.
CSRF protection state parameter. Recommended for security. Will be included in the callback response.

User identity hint for test OAuth provider. Allows specifying a desired user identity for testing and automation. Only supported by the test provider (ignored by production providers like Google, GitHub, etc.). Must be 3-20 characters, alphanumeric and hyphens only.
(Required) OAuth 2.0 scope parameter. For OpenID Connect, must include "openid". Supports "profile" and "email" scopes. Other scopes are silently ignored. Space-separated values.

description.content: OAuth provider authorization URL with client_id, redirect_uri, response_type, scope, and state parameters

response.name: Invalid provider or provider not configured

query.description: OAuth provider identifier. Defaults to 'test' provider in non-production builds if not specified.
Client callback URL where TMI should redirect after successful OAuth completion with tokens as query parameters. If not provided, tokens are returned as JSON response.
CSRF protection state parameter. Recommended for security. Will be included in the callback response.

User identity hint for test OAuth provider. Allows specifying a desired user identity for testing and automation. Only supported by the test provider (ignored by production providers like Google, GitHub, etc.). Must be 3-20 characters, alphanumeric and hyphens only.
(Required) OAuth 2.0 scope parameter. For OpenID Connect, must include "openid". Supports "profile" and "email" scopes. Other scopes are silently ignored. Space-separated values.

response.name: Internal server error generating authorization URL

query.description: OAuth provider identifier. Defaults to 'test' provider in non-production builds if not specified.
Client callback URL where TMI should redirect after successful OAuth completion with tokens as query parameters. If not provided, tokens are returned as JSON response.
CSRF protection state parameter. Recommended for security. Will be included in the callback response.

User identity hint for test OAuth provider. Allows specifying a desired user identity for testing and automation. Only supported by the test provider (ignored by production providers like Google, GitHub, etc.). Must be 3-20 characters, alphanumeric and hyphens only.
(Required) OAuth 2.0 scope parameter. For OpenID Connect, must include "openid". Supports "profile" and "email" scopes. Other scopes are silently ignored. Space-separated values.
OAuth provider identifier. Defaults to 'test' provider in non-production builds if not specified.

request.description: Provider-neutral endpoint to exchange OAuth authorization codes for TMI JWT tokens. Supports Google, GitHub, and Microsoft OAuth providers.

response.name: OAuth exchange successful, TMI JWT tokens issued

query.description: OAuth provider identifier. Defaults to 'test' provider in non-production builds if not specified.

response.name: Bad request - invalid provider, missing parameters, or invalid state

query.description: OAuth provider identifier. Defaults to 'test' provider in non-production builds if not specified.

response.name: Internal server error - OAuth provider communication failed

query.description: OAuth provider identifier. Defaults to 'test' provider in non-production builds if not specified.

request.description: Exchanges a refresh token for a new JWT access token

response.name: Bad request - missing or invalid refresh token
Unauthorized - invalid or expired refresh token

request.description: Returns information about the currently authenticated user

query.description: (Required) Authorization code from the OAuth provider
Optional state parameter for CSRF protection

request.description: Exchanges OAuth authorization code for JWT tokens. If client_callback was provided during authorization, redirects to client with tokens. Otherwise returns tokens as JSON response.

response.name: JWT tokens issued successfully (legacy mode when no client_callback provided)

query.description: (Required) Authorization code from the OAuth provider
Optional state parameter for CSRF protection

response.name: Redirect to client callback URL with tokens (when client_callback was provided)

query.description: (Required) Authorization code from the OAuth provider
Optional state parameter for CSRF protection

description.content: Client callback URL with access_token, refresh_token, expires_in, token_type, and state as query parameters

Optional state parameter for CSRF protection

request.description: Invalidates the user's JWT token by adding it to a blacklist, effectively ending the session. Once logged out, the token cannot be used for further authenticated requests until it naturally expires. The token blacklist is maintained in Redis with automatic cleanup based on token expiration times.

response.name: User logged out successfully. The JWT token has been invalidated and added to the blacklist.
Authentication failed - invalid, missing, or malformed token
Internal server error - token blacklisting failed

request.description: Returns all currently active collaboration sessions for diagrams. Clients can use this endpoint to discover existing sessions before connecting via WebSocket.

response.name: Authentication failed - invalid, missing, or malformed token

request.description: Retrieves the current collaboration session details for a diagram. The session payload indicates who has been authorized to the session, not who is currently active in the WebSocket session. The 200 status indicates successful retrieval - clients must NOT evaluate the payload to determine session status.

variable.description: (Required) Unique identifier of the threat model (UUID)
(Required) Unique identifier of the diagram (UUID)

request.description: Creates a new collaboration session for real-time diagram editing. Only one collaboration session can exist per diagram at a time. If a session already exists, returns 409 with a link to join the existing session.

response.name: Collaboration session created successfully. The 201 status indicates successful creation - clients must NOT evaluate the payload to determine success.
Collaboration session already exists for this diagram

variable.description: (Required) Unique identifier of the threat model (UUID)
(Required) Unique identifier of the diagram (UUID)

request.description: Joins an existing collaboration session for real-time diagram editing. The session must already exist.

response.name: Successfully joined collaboration session. The 200 status indicates successful join - clients must NOT evaluate the payload to determine success.

variable.description: (Required) Unique identifier of the threat model (UUID)
(Required) Unique identifier of the diagram (UUID)

request.description: Terminates the active collaboration session for a diagram
